TopicTitle: Land on minmus with no landing legs and minimum parts possible!

Articles.Content:
Land on minmus with no landing legs and minimum parts possible! I did it with 8 parts and no landing legs. Here is the video: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/-Ali8Gz3VUw" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Can you do it?

Please post a pic or video of you completing the challenge.

Thank you for taking notice
TBH, since the large tanks came out, this kind of "least parts possible" challenges became quite watered down.... Anyway, I think you can that with 3 parts, based on
I thought I did very well considering I've never been to the mun yet. Never mind. Might try and do it with 3 parts too

That was not a diss , Your attempt is pretty good, and the 3 parts rocket I shown is actually being piloted by a astrophysicist of formation I am pretty sure I could not do it

What I was saying about the parts is that you can transform a 6 part rocket in a 3 part rocket by simply taking a rocket with a capsule, a engine and 4 small tanks and trade those 4 tanks for a half big tank: they weight the same drag the same and carry the same amount of fuel. So the least parts challenges lost a little of it's meaning IMHO ...
